case.name: MZXME v Minister for Immigration & Citizenship [2007] FCA 767 (18 May 2007)

citphrases.citphrase: purported appeal from judgment of federal magistrate
dismissal of application due to failure of applicant to appear
failure to appear at directions hearing
applications for an extension of time in which to appeal and for leave to appeal the interlocutory judgment of a federal magistrate
where application dismissed by federal magistrate due to non-attendance
application for extension of time and for leave to appeal
application for extension of time refused
factors relevant to exercise of discretion
to do justice between the parties

citances.sentence: No explanation is provided in the Applicant's Affidavit as to why any application for leave to appeal was not filed within the time prescribed. In such circumstances a proceeding may be dismissed: e.g. MZXME v Minister for Immigration and Citizenship [2007] FCA 767.

12 As is apparent from what I have said, I have taken the course I adopted in MZWIK v Minister for Immigration & Multicultural & Indigenous Affairs [2005] FCA 185 (see also MZWXC v Minister for Immigration and Multicultural and Indigenous Affairs [2006] FCA 172 at [9] and MZXME v Minister for Immigration & Citizenship [2007] FCA 767) , and instead of requiring the applicant to take the proper course, have considered whether there is sufficient merit in his case to justify the grant of leave to appeal. Plainly there is not.
